page.title: 01TEBAY VILLAGE 1985
page.content: The village is near interchange 38 of the{M6}& the mainline{railway-LONDON {to GLASGOW.}In the Lune Valley,Eden District Council Area;12 miles to {Kendal,18 to Penrith.}Amenities:3 shops,1 pub,1 club,2 garages,1 service area,1 church,1 chapel.There is a{ {Motte & Bailey}mound.The railway was electrified in{1970s.}The land is rough grazing & hay.We have a reacreation ground.The population is around{600 and falling. The primary school has 42 children compared with 72 three years ago. The temperature is around -10'C ] in winter.In the summer it is 10 to 25 'C.Autumn can be from 5 to 20'C.Spring is cold to start, getting warmer.1984 was a bad spring but a hot summer.1985 is so far a very cold spring with not a very good start to the summer. {Andrew.J.Seward.& Keith.B.Wall.
